abstract.original_text: Figure 52-1 Acute mastoiditis. Extension of the acute inflammatory process from the middle ear and mastoid air cell systems to the overlying soft tissues displaces the auricle in an inferior and lateral direction from the side of the head. Fluctuance may be palpated over the mastoid cortex, and a defect in the cortical bone can frequently be appreciated. Surgical drainage with mastoidectomy is required.

sentences.segment_text: Extension of the acute inflammatory process from the middle ear and mastoid air cell systems to the overlying soft tissues displaces the auricle in an inferior and lateral direction from the side of the head .
Fluctuance may be palpated over the mastoid cortex ,
and a defect in the cortical bone can frequently be appreciated .
Surgical drainage with mastoidectomy is required .
